model_outputs.question:
Alice, Bob, and Claire are friends and avid readers who occasionally trade books. At the start of the semester, they each buy one new book: Alice gets Ulysses, Bob gets Frankenstein, and Claire gets Lolita.
As the semester proceeds, they start trading around the new books. First, Claire and Bob swap books. Then, Bob and Alice swap books. Finally, Claire and Bob swap books. At the end of the semester, Bob has
Options:
(A) Ulysses
(B) Frankenstein
(C) Lolita
model_outputs.model_answer:
Step 1: Identify the starting positions.
Alice has Ulysses, Bob has Frankenstein, and Claire has Lolita at the beginning.

Step 2: Determine the order of the swaps.
The order of the swaps is: Claire and Bob swap books, then Bob and Alice swap books, and finally Claire and Bob swap books again.

Step 3: Trace the movement of each book through the swaps.
After the first swap, Claire has Frankenstein and Bob has Lolita.
After the second swap, Alice has Lolita and Bob has Ulysses.
After the third swap, Claire has Lolita and Bob has Frankenstein.

Step 4: Identify the book Bob has at the end of the semester.
Bob has Frankenstein at the end of the semester.

Step 5: Provide the answer.
The answer is (B) Frankenstein.
